clinical_study.official_title: Investigation on the Microbial Biomarkers of AGI in the Early Stage

collaborator.agency: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: AGI is very common in ICU and sometimes will trigger the development of gut derived sepsis. Thus, to find out the biomarker in early stage is very important to improve the overall prognosis of critically ill patients. In this project we try to find out the microbial biomarker of AGI through multi-omic technology.

primary_outcome.measure: The AUC value of the combined markers
primary_outcome.description: The combined diagnostic accuracy of AGI through omic parameters

arm_group.description: the observational group to find out the potential biomarker
the validation group to validate the parameters used for early diagnosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: All those critically ill patients with anticipated ICU stay for more than 2 days Exclusion Criteria:Patients will be excluded if they have any of the following situations: patients who have not signed the informed consent; Unable to tolerate intra-abdominal pressure monitoring; pregnant woman; Patients after bladder surgery; Systemic diseases and recent use of related drugs; He had a history of infectious diseases, such as tuberculosis or PPD positive. History of hypertension and poor blood pressure control (SBP / DBP > = 140mmHg); Patients with severe mental illness; Long term use of traditional Chinese medicine, probiotics, gastric mucosal protective agents, proton pump inhibitors, chemotherapy or immunosuppressive drugs, etc. were not included if the drug was not stopped within one month before admission.
